publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7816 Christina McKelvie: Wishaw Crime Drops 10%—That the Parliament welcomes the news that violent and domestic crimes in Wishaw have dropped 10% in the past year; applauds Wishaw Communities Police Unit in the work that it has done to bring the crime rate down; notes that cases of domestic violence fell from 827 in 2009 to 632 in 2010; further notes that in 2010 the number of violent crimes fell 11.9%; applauds the Scottish Government and the Cabinet Secretary for Justice for their commitment to tackling domestic and violent crimes in Scotland, and notes the extra 1,000 police officers on Scotland’s streets who have contributed to enabling local community police units to carry out such vital work.
